With the patient's unstable condition, the most appropriate next step in management is to take the patient to the OR for an exploratory laparotomy. Option A, CT of the abdomen and pelvis with contrast, may delay surgical intervention. Option C, obtaining a retrograde urethrogram, is not necessary at this time as there are no signs of injury to the urinary tract. Option D, performing a diagnostic peritoneal lavage, can be helpful in evaluating intra-abdominal bleeding, but it is not as definitive as exploratory laparotomy.
